reporting-org.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs

title.narrative: Enhance access to life-saving community-based protection services (GBV MA) for the Women, girls, and other vulnerable for IDPs and host communities in WGSSs and widows camps in three locations in NWS.

description.narrative: WSA runs three WGSS in Hazano, KafrTakarim, and Kafrlucin in Idleb, since 2018, and planining to continue implementing activities through providing protection services for women and girls affected by the crisis, including GBV survivors Hazano WGSS is funded through HF and contributes to the promotion of services and measures of MA and quality GBV providing services to prevent and reduce the risks of GBV and COVID in the mentioned location, with the GBV SC amp MA SC Guidelines. For this WGSS we are proposing to continue providing specialized GBV services, Case Management, and specialized individual PSS Case workers will follow up with the WampG-GBV survivors. In addition to providing case fund to GBV survivors in accordance with the GBV SC Cash SOPs. service and referrals to other services according to the referral paths that are shared by the sub-clusters and creating a service mapping through coordination with actors in the area, continuously updated. Preventive activities, such as life skills (My safety my wellbeing), recreational activities, GBV awareness raising (GBV-SC toolkit), and Covid related awareness (WHO tools For the other two WGSSs in KafrTakarim and Kaferluci, which are funded by UNFPA, different tyoes of GBV servicers including both response and prevention services are provided. In this project, new activities will be added in the three proposed WGSS with the aim to enhance the protection and empowerment of women and girls, namely: 1-conducting vocational trainings for WampG, such as hairdressing, sewing, Microsoft Office programs, and ..etc. based on needs,400 WampG will be targeted in the three sites 2-Providing Individual Protection Assistance (IPA) to vulnerable women and girls According to specific criteria(widows and divorced, women-headed households elderly-headed households households with persons with disabilities(PwD) newly arrived displaced persons without shelter)total of 100$ 3 - 5 widow camps will be targeted to provide a package of life-saving services to empower adolescent girls and their mothers including:safety audit activity to assess and address risk factors related to protecting women and girls from GBV in camps. Awareness sessions on GBV Life skills programs for women and girls Connecting male children to services according to referral pathways to child protection The camps that WSA will target are Dar-Al Eiman- Kelly, Aa'esha - Foah, AL BER and Taqwa and al amal Village -Qah and Mothers of the Believers - Harim. Services will be provided to widows within the WGSSs or activities halls in camps, according to the situation of each camp and the type of the service In case of an emergency situation, WSA will use the Protection Cluster Emergency Response Package to Provide emergency response for WampG: PFA, referrals, registration. 4-providing small grants for 50 women out of the 400 in training to start a small project with the aim of generating income and economic independence for them women and girls in WGSSs and camps As per specific criteria: -Survivors of GBV specially widows, divorced and survivors withPwD -Females headed households The other part of the criteria will look the performance of the participant in the training period and will include: Commitment during the training period minimum 80% of the sessions -Adapting the necessary skills in the selected profession -Having a project idea in line wi Having a project idea in line with the market need on average 850$per case Capacity building activities will include training and refresher sessions on PSEA to all WSA staff in the three locations.Trainings for non-specialized GBV service providers in Hazzano, on GBV basic concepts focusing on health actors, cash and voucher distributors workers, and early recovery actors According to the latest developments regarding the global pandemic of Coronavirus, the provision of GBVservices will be in line with the WHO guidelines, and following the guidance GBV-SC during COVID.

owner-org.narrative: United Nations OCHA Financial Tracking Service (UN OCHA FTS)
